Ex 4 Page 16

A fine tube bent in the form of ellipse is held with its plane vertical and is filled with $n$ liquids whose densities are $\rho_1, \dots, \rho_n$ taken in order round the elliptic tube. If $r_1, \dots, r_n$ be the distances of the points of separation from either focus, prove that $$r_1(\rho_1-\rho_2) + r_2 (\rho_2 - \rho_3) + \dots + r_n(\rho_n - \rho_1) = 0$$

Let $S$ be the focus and $ZZ'$ be the directrix of the elliptic tube.

Let $P_1, P_2, \dots, P_n$ be the common surfaces.

Then we get $SP_1 = r_1$, $SP_2 =r_2, \dots, SP_n = r_n$.

Let $z_1, z_2, \dots, z_n$ be the depths of $P_1, P_2, \dots, P_n$ from the directrix respectively.

Then $\dfrac{z_1}{r_1} = \dfrac{z_2}{r_2} = \cdots = \dfrac{z_n}{r_n} = \text{constant}$

Let $k$ be that constant.

Then $z_1 = kr_1$, $z_2 = kr_2$, ..., $z_n = kr_n$

Let $p_1, p_2, \dots p_n$ be pressure at $P_1, P_2, \dots, P_n$ respectively.

The pressure at $P_1$ is $p_1 = \rho_1 g (z_1 -z_0)$.

The pressure at $P_2$ is $p_2 = \rho_1 g (z_1 -z_0) + \rho_2 g (z_2 -z_1)$.

$$\begin{align*} \mbox{Hence } p_2 - p_1 &= \rho_2 g (z_2 -z_1) \\ \mbox{Similarly } p_3 - p_2 &= \rho_3 g (z_3 -z_2) \\ \cdots & \cdots \\ p_n - p_{n-1} &= \rho_n g (z_n -z_{n-1}) \\ p_1 - p_{n} &= \rho_1 g (z_1 -z_n) \\ \mbox{Adding, } 0 &= g\sbracket{ \rho_2 (z_2 -z_1) + \rho_3 (z_3 -z_2) + \dots + \rho_n(z_n -z_{n-1}) + \rho_1 g (z_1 -z_n) } \\ 0 &= \rho_2 (z_2 -z_1) + \rho_3 (z_3 -z_2) + \dots + \rho_n(z_n -z_{n-1}) + \rho_1 g (z_1 -z_n) \\ 0 &= \rho_2 (kr_2 -kr_1) + \rho_3 (kr_3 - kr_2) + \dots + \rho_n(kr_n - kr_{n-1}) + \rho_1 g (kr_1 - kr_n) \\ 0 &= \rho_2 (r_2 -r_1) + \rho_3 (r_3 - r_2) + \dots + \rho_n(r_n - r_{n-1}) + \rho_1 g (r_1 - r_n) \\ 0 &= r_1(\rho_1-\rho_2) + r_2 (\rho_2 - \rho_3) + \dots + r_n(\rho_n - \rho_1) \end{align*}$$
